= Motion Along a Straight Line =

== TL;DR ==

*Average speed*
{{$
\frac{[\text{distance traveled}]}{[\text{time taken}]}
}}$
*Average velocity*
{{$
\overline{v} = \frac{\Delta x}{\Delta t}
}}$
*Instantaneous velocity*
{{$
v = \lim_{\Delta t \to 0} \frac{\Delta x}{\Delta t}
}}$
*Average acceleration*
{{$
\overline{a} = \frac{\Delta v}{\Delta t}
}}$
*Instantaneous acceleration*
{{$
a = \lim_{\Delta t \to 0} \frac{\Delta v}{\Delta t}
}}$
*Motion with constant acceleration*
{{$
\begin{align}
  v &= v_0 + at \\
  x &= x_0 + v_0t + \frac{1}{2}at^2 \\
  a(x-x_0) &= \frac{1}{2}(v^2 - v_0^2) \\
\end{align}
}}$
Acceleration of free fall
{{$
g \simeq 9.81 \mathrm{ms}^{-2}
}}$
Free fall (positive direction upwards):
{{$
\begin{align}
  v &= v_0 - gt \\
  x &= x_0 + v_0t - \frac{1}{2}gt^2 \\
  -g(x - x_0) &= \frac{1}{2}(v^2 - v_0^2)
\end{align}
}}$

== Measurement of Space and Time; Units ==

| Freedom Units | SI Units                   |
|---------------|----------------------------|
| mile          | 1 mi = 5280 ft = 1609.38 m |
| yard          | 1 yd = 3 ft = 0.9144 m     |
| foot          | 1 ft = 0.3048 m            |
| inch          | 1 in. = 1/12 ft = 2.540 cm |

== Average Speed ==

{{$
\bar{v} = \frac{x}{t}
}}$

Where _x_ is the distance and _t_ is the time.

== Average Velocity for Motion Along a Straight Line ==

{{$
\bar{v} = \frac{x_2 - x_1}{t_2 - t_1}
}}$

aka

{{$
\bar{v} = \frac{\Delta x}{\Delta t}
}}$

== Instantaneous Velocity ==

{{$
v = \frac{\Delta x}{\Delta t} \text{ with extremely small } \Delta t
}}$

aka

{{$
v = \lim_{\Delta t \to 0} \frac{\Delta x}{\Delta t}
}}$

== Acceleration ==

Average Acceleration

{{$
\bar{a} = \frac{v_2 - v_1}{t_2 - t_1}
}}$

aka

{{$
\bar{a} = \frac{\Delta v}{\Delta t}
}}$

Instantaneous Acceleration

{{$
a = \frac{\Delta v}{\Delta t} \text{ with extremely small } \Delta t
}}$

aka

{{$
a = \lim_{\Delta t \to 0} \frac{\Delta v}{\Delta t}
}}$

== Motion with Constant Acceleration ==

Velocity

{{$
v = v_0 + at
}}$

Distance

{{$
x = x_0 + v_0t + \frac{1}{2}at^2
}}$

{{$
x - x_0 = v_0t + \frac{1}{2}at^2
}}$

Timeless equation

{{$
\begin{aligned}
t & = \frac{v-v_0}{a} \\
x-x_0 & = v_0(\frac{v-v_0}{a}) + \frac{1}{2}a(\frac{v-v_0}{a})^2 \\
& = \frac{v_0v - v_0^2}{a} + \frac{\frac{1}{2}(v^2-2vv_0 + v_0^2)}{a} \\
& = \frac{\frac{1}{2}(v^2-v_0^2)}{a}
\end{aligned}
}}$

{{$
a(x - x_0) = \frac{1}{2}(v^2 - v_0^2)
}}$

For velocity

{{$
v^2 - v_0^2 = 2a(x - x_0)
}}$


For distance

{{$
x - x_0 = \frac{v^2 - v_0^2}{2a}
}}$

== The Acceleration of Free Fall ==

Average gravitational acceleration at the surface of the earth

{{$
g \simeq 9.81 \mathrm{ms}^{-2}
}}$

Free fall (positive direction upwards)

{{$
v = v_0 - gt
}}$

{{$
x = x_0 + v_0t - \frac{1}{2}gt^2
}}$

{{$
-g(x - x_0) = \frac{1}{2}(v^2 - v_0^2)
}}$
